comments.html: Just an FYI, I tried once to use a CF card-to-PCMCIA adapter on a 1602 router to see if the router would see it.  The router kicked out an error indicating there was something missing (I assume there is a special IC in the Cisco-approved PCMCIA flash cards) and kicked out an error and froze - no boot, nothing.  It isn't entirely related to the post but should show the older Cisco gear appears to have some specific requirements for flash used on the devices that newer gear (x800s, etc) doesn't.
comments.name: Anonymous
